Reason: The 'row_cache_save_period' configuration in the Cassandra project is performance-sensitive because changing its value can significantly impact system performance. This configuration determines how frequently the row cache is saved to disk, affecting memory consumption and disk I/O operations. A lower value can increase memory usage and disk writes, potentially leading to performance degradation, while a higher value can reduce these resources but may also impact read performance due to stale cache data. Therefore, any change in the 'row_cache_save_period' value can have notable variations in system performance, making it a performance-sensitive configuration.
